title.narrative: Poultry Farm

description.narrative: An Army CTS, a group of female soldiers who work with Special Operations Forces in remote locations to address local needs, is examining the possibility of developing a poultry farm in cooperation with a local farmer. Poultry farming has been identified as a sustainable source of revenue in the area. The team requested a subject matter expert provide technical expertise on raising small chicken farms. The ITRCB Animal Health Program Manager is consulting with in-country personnel on this activity

person-name.narrative: Daniel Herche and Tyson Whitney; Ryan Boles

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Salaries and Expenses
Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Salaries and Expenses

title.narrative: Training Course

description.narrative: Plant Pest Identification Training, Herat, Afghanistan. Conducted an intensive training that provided extensive hands-on experience in a laboratory setting in approaching identification of unknown pests and diseases of plants. Provided a series of lectures on the principles of plant disease diagnostics and key needs related to diagnostics, including the development of a plant diagnostic clinic, as well as record keeping methodology. Provided a complete set of training materials that may be reviewed and customized by Afghan personnel for development of DAIL offices. Developed contacts with MAIL Plant Protection staff so they will be comfortable asking for support related to their programs.

person-name.narrative: Daniel Herche and Tyson Whitney; Ryan Boles

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Salaries and Expenses
Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Salaries and Expenses

title.narrative: Workshop

description.narrative: A Train-the-Trainer Workshop was held in Paktika Province in November. The purpose of the workshop was to provide information to the five Afghan Ag Trainers employed by PRT Orgun-E and supervised by a USDA Agriculture Advisor. Training was provided in three areas, key pests and their management in apple, nematode pests of wheat and benefits of membership in Afghanistans National Nursery Growers Organization.

person-name.narrative: Daniel Herche and Tyson Whitney; Ryan Boles

sector.narrative: Plant and post-harvest protection and pest control

title.narrative: Capacity Building and Change Management Program

description.narrative: This project, conducted by the Volunteers for Economic Growth Alliance (VEGA) consortium, aims to implement a comprehensive change management program at the Afghanistan Ministroy of Agriculture, Irrigation, and Livestock (MAIL). The CBCMP is comprised of two components with a unique set of objectives. Component One aims to increase MAIL's ability to manage its financial, physical, and human resources. Component Two promotes institutional capacity-building and change management through implementation of four pillars of organizational management: progress scorecards, annual work planning, service-delivery process improvement, and organizational structure analysis. Component Two is active at the Ministry and in the extension sections in 11 targeted provincial Directorates of Agriculture, Irrigation, and Livestock (DAILs). Both objectives focus on contributing to and stimulating purposeful, organizational and functional change at MAIL, leading to a modernized ministry capable of delivering agricultural services. The project also includes Senior Provincial Management Specialists and IT infrastructure improvement in all 34 provincial DAILs.

person-name.narrative: Daniel Herche and Tyson Whitney; Ryan Boles

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Foreign Agricultural Service, Salaries and Expenses

title.narrative: e-Afghan Ag

description.narrative: Provide an improved, publically accessible UC Davis Afghanistan Agriculture Knowledge Resource online. As part of the project, UC Davis will undertake extensive original research to develop Provincial/District-level agricultural information to add to national level subject matter.

person-name.narrative: Daniel Herche and Tyson Whitney; Ryan Boles

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Foreign Agricultural Service, Salaries and Expenses

title.narrative: Agricultural Developmnet for Afghansitan Pre-deployment Training (ADAPT)

description.narrative: Development and implementation a core curriculum in basic agriculture and related practices relevant to Afghanistan in technical subject areas including: Animal Husbandry, Rangeland/Pasture Management, Crop & Horticulture Production, Orchard & Vineyard Management including post-harvest practices, Irrigation Water Management and Soils.

person-name.narrative: Daniel Herche and Tyson Whitney; Ryan Boles

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Foreign Agricultural Service, Salaries and Expenses

title.narrative: Agricultural Data Collection and Utilization System

description.narrative: The Ministry of Agriculture, Irrigation and Livestock (MAIL) data collection and utilization system project is designed to work with leadership in MAIL to define a set critical provincial level data that can be used as benchmarks for the agriculture sector and provide information to inform MAIL policy. The MAIL Agricultural Data Collection and Utilization System Project (ADCUS) will work with the appropriate MAIL departments to develop and implement a plan for collecting and analyzing the data, and developing data products to inform MAIL leadership. The project will be designed to work with MAIL to identify critical data needs and to work with appropriate MAIL staff to develop capacity develop and implement provincial level data collection.

person-name.narrative: Daniel Herche and Tyson Whitney; Ryan Boles

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Foreign Agricultural Service, Salaries and Expenses

title.narrative: Defense Threat Reduction (DOD)

description.narrative: Afghanistan Table Top Exercise Sandia labs organized a table top like exercise in Turkey to determine outbreak procedures in Afghanistan's public and animal health sectors in support of DTRA's Afghanistan mission. Sandia Labs used two SME's for epidemiology, regulatory medicine, and diagnostic medicine. The scenarios were PPR (animal), CCHF (public health), and brucellosis (zoonotic). It was a three day event. Day one they split up animal and public health and worked through their scenarios. Day two each group presented their scenarios and identified gaps; then they formed one group and began to work through the zoonotic scenario. The first half of day three was dedicated to working through the scenario; the second half of day three, the entire scenario was presented and they worked to identify gaps

person-name.narrative: Daniel Herche and Tyson Whitney; Ryan Boles

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Department of Defense, Cooperative Threat Reduction Account
Department of Defense, Cooperative Threat Reduction Account

title.narrative: Food for Progress

description.narrative: The Food for Progress Program provides for the donation of U.S. agricultural commodities to developing countries and emerging democracies that are committed to introducing or expanding free enterprise in their agricultural economies. The program has two primary strategic objectives: (1) increase agricultural productivity and (2) expand trade of agricultural products.
